newsitem.title: PAKISTAN: Pakistan officials say missing climbers dead.
newsitem.headline: Pakistan officials say missing climbers dead.

text.p: Three missing climbers, two Britons and a New Zealander, have died in an avalanche high on a mountain in northern Pakistan, officials said on Monday.

A Pakistani official in the northern town of Gilgit said that Stephen Thornley, 25, and Andrew Boas, 24, both British, and Christopher Hoare, a New Zealander, had died on August 12 in the Shamshal Valley on the 7,885-metre (25,869-foot) peak of Disteghil Sar.
He said death certificates for the three men had been issued on Sunday.
Three other climbers from the same expedition, all New Zealanders, were expected to arrive in Islamabad on Monday or Tuesday.
